text: Hey Maciek! Good to meet you! I'm Kat, I'm a Senior Character Animator at Jellyfish Pictures.

Hi Kat! Nice to meet you too! My name is Maciek and I'm on my third year at Escape Studios studying Computer Animation. That's great you work at Jellyfish Pictures :slightly_smiling_face: I hope I'll work there one day. Is it possible to have a good work/life balance?
Also, I'm curious how did you get into the industry? :slightly_smiling_face:
Awesome! How are you finding it at Escape?

A work life balance is definitely possible! I think a lot of people, especially those newer to the industry, feel like they need to stay late to prove themselves, but all it ends up doing is burning them out. I feel quite strongly about it actually, because when people stay late, it also messes up with production deadlines and can make others feel like they have to do the same thing. So leaving on time and having a life outside of work is essential in my opinion!

As for me, my grad film is really what set me on the path. I graduated in 2013 from the Arts University Bournemouth. My first job was at TeamTO in France on a kids TV series, then I got headhunted by Framestore after they saw my grad film and I moved to London to work on Guardians of the Galaxy. Since then I've worked all over the place here in London! My latest was at Studio AKA on a 30 minute film that just released on AppleTV, and I did a short stint at DNEG Features and now I'm here at Jellyfish working on their upcoming feature film ^^
What is it that got you interested in studying animation? Do you have any goals for your future career?
